About

Honda Civic SI EP3

The 7th generation Honda Civic SI EP3 is charming. Some may see that as an indictment. If you're nostalgic for the angsty, featherweight, 8000 rpm insanity of the 1990s-era Honda hatchbacks, this car will disappoint you, but if you're just tired of driving a numbed-out family sedan, this is the car for you. The EP3 lacks the table-stakes comforts we've come to expect from modern cars: the cabin is too noisy, the suspension too harsh, the hatchback body is incredibly stiff. The engine is underpowered, but it's so full of youthful, unbridled joy; as soon as you push beyond 5k, it goes: "WEEEEE this is so much fun!! Make me go FASTER FASTER!". The EP3 is "slow car fast" - it does little to mediate your driving experience, so it gives you that nervous, exhilarating "I'm going too fast" feeling at about 50mph.

To sum up, driving the EP3 provides sustained low-stakes excitement.

This Honda Civic SI EP3

I purchased this 2002 Honda Civic SI EP3 in 2019 with 160,000 miles on it. I am the 3rd owner; the car has a clean title and has not been in any accidents. This EP3 has been my daily driver and has a little less than 190,000 miles on it now. I have kept up with preventative maintenance and have encountered no mechanical problems since purchasing the car. The car is all stock/OEM except for the AEM cold air intake. I enjoy maintaining my car's appearance, so the interior/exterior are in good condition. The car does have an assortment of small dents and chips that you would expect to find on a daily-driven car of this age.
